text:
I don't seem to be able to update a private registry using `1.6-beta1` . I wonder if anyone can advise on where the issue might be and where i should report this?
```(@v1.6) pkg> registry up
    Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/General`
    Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/PackageRegistry`
    Updating git-repo `<mailto:git@gitlab.invenia.ca|git@gitlab.invenia.ca>:invenia/PackageRegistry`
SSH host verification: the identity of the server `<http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>` does not match its known hosts record. Someone could be trying to man-in-the-middle your connection. It is also possible that the server has changed its key, in which case you should check with the server administrator and if they confirm that the key has been changed, update your known hosts file.
┌ Warning: Some registries failed to update:
│     — /Users/nick/.julia/registries/PackageRegistry — failed to fetch from repo
└ @ Pkg.Types /Users/julia/src/julia/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.6/Pkg/src/Types.jl:1183

julia> VERSION
v"1.6.0-beta1"```

elements.text: I don't seem to be able to update a private registry using
1.6-beta1
. I wonder if anyone can advise on where the issue might be and where i should report this?

(@v1.6) pkg> registry up
    Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/General`
    Updating registry at `~/.julia/registries/PackageRegistry`
    Updating git-repo `git@gitlab.invenia.ca:invenia/PackageRegistry`
SSH host verification: the identity of the server `gitlab.invenia.ca` does not match its known hosts record. Someone could be trying to man-in-the-middle your connection. It is also possible that the server has changed its key, in which case you should check with the server administrator and if they confirm that the key has been changed, update your known hosts file.
┌ Warning: Some registries failed to update:
│     — /Users/nick/.julia/registries/PackageRegistry — failed to fetch from repo
└ @ Pkg.Types /Users/julia/src/julia/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.6/Pkg/src/Types.jl:1183

julia> VERSION
v"1.6.0-beta1"

then

had the same issue with the same server, so it seems that multiple Invenians have old keys in their known hosts file for this server

text:
> If it doesn’t exist, it should  get added automatically.  If it doesn’t, that’s a problem
After prompting you mean? Currently you have to add it outside of Julia IIRC.

elements.text: If it doesn’t exist, it should  get added automatically.  If it doesn’t, that’s a problem
After prompting you mean? Currently you have to add it outside of Julia IIRC.

text: wait really?  I thought there was only a prompt if there was a conflict

text: What do you mean? When you ssh to a new server you always have to manually accept, no?

elements.text: What do you mean? When you ssh to a new server you always have to manually accept, no?

text: sorry, for some reason my brain substituted “prompt” with “error”.

text: libgit2's shitty API doesn’t actually give enough information in the callback to add the host to the known hosts file; I also think it’s probably better to just tell someone to do it externally with `ssh`

elements.text: libgit2's shitty API doesn’t actually give enough information in the callback to add the host to the known hosts file; I also think it’s probably better to just tell someone to do it externally with
ssh

text:
i deleted the `<http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>` entry from the `know_hosts` file, and removed the invenia registry, then did
```nick@nickwork ~/.j/registries>
git clone <mailto:git@gitlab.invenia.ca|git@gitlab.invenia.ca>:invenia/PackageRegistry.git
Cloning into 'PackageRegistry'...
The authenticity of host '<http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca> (54.204.245.62)' can't be established.
ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:9oGrB5kNOFwCJNTGv5oAZoPLfpseLFMKruHuk3MsWc8.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added '<http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>,54.204.245.62' (ECDSA) to the list of known hosts.```
and i still see the same thing

the relevant line in the `known_hosts` file is
```<http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>,54.204.245.62 ecdsa-sha2-nistp256 AAAAE2VjZHNhLXNoYTItbmlzdHAyNTYAAAAIbmlzdHAyNTYAAABBBAa7BE2JdARswKmt78V0rrQOj0dVWDISAWkrsI3y/lmfHlHea96IQ0VdjPzpmAs9JO4YnjI+bc9tgAsycy9/j4g=```
(p.s. the gitlab server does not have a static IP address)

I think that is expected to have fixed it? Since it didn't, i'll open a Pkg issue summarising this :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
> (p.s. the gitlab server does not have a static IP address)
You will get the error everytime the IP changes I think? But I guess it is not switching that often?

elements.text: (p.s. the gitlab server does not have a static IP address)
You will get the error everytime the IP changes I think? But I guess it is not switching that often?

text: <https://superuser.com/questions/602542/ssh-known-host-with-dynamic-address>

attachments.title: SSH: known host with dynamic address
attachments.text: I need to connect to a host with a dynamic IP address. Every time its IP changes, SSH prompts me the fingerprint validation thing: The authenticity of host '...' can't be established. RSA key
attachments.fallback: Super User: SSH: known host with dynamic address

text: Maybe try with `CheckHostIP no`?

elements.text: Maybe try with
CheckHostIP no

text:
No luck with that.

i tried editing my `.ssh/config` to have either
```Host <http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>
  HostKeyAlias gitlabserver```
or
```Host <http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca>
  CheckHostIP no
  StrictHostKeyChecking no```
then deleting the registry and re-cloning it, but still see the same thing

But perhaps that's not quite what you were suggesting?

elements.text:
No luck with that.

i tried editing my
.ssh/config
to have either

Host gitlab.invenia.ca
  HostKeyAlias gitlabserver
or

Host gitlab.invenia.ca
  CheckHostIP no
  StrictHostKeyChecking no

then deleting the registry and re-cloning it, but still see the same thing

But perhaps that's not quite what you were suggesting?

text: Julia won't read the ssh config anyway

elements.text: Julia won't read the ssh config anyway

text: The IP changes frequently. It's behind an AWS load balancer.

elements.text: The IP changes frequently. It's behind an AWS load balancer.

text: `ssh-keyscan <http://gitlab.invenia.ca|gitlab.invenia.ca> >> /Users/nick/.ssh/known_hosts`  seems to have fixed it!

elements.text: ssh-keyscan
gitlab.invenia.ca
>> /Users/nick/.ssh/known_hosts
seems to have fixed it!

text: Thank you very much for the help everyone!

elements.text: Thank you very much for the help everyone!

text: Okay I did discover a bug while doing this; it should be prompting you to update using the above but instead it rejects with the `SSH host verification`. I'll make an issue for that one.

elements.text: Okay I did discover a bug while doing this; it should be prompting you to update using the above but instead it rejects with the
SSH host verification
. I'll make an issue for that one.

text: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/2334>
Basically, git doesn't prompt or error when the IP changes as long as the fingerprint is the same

elements.text: Basically, git doesn't prompt or error when the IP changes as long as the fingerprint is the same
